result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dayshawn Deshay Lloyd

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dayshawn Deshay Lloyd appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Glenn Oswald Givens Jr in court for Dayshawn Deshay Lloyd.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective Maxwell Ours.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter from defendant re:  signature bond.  (Dayshawn D. Lloyd - #2022008982, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense; signed and filed.

Defendant Dayshawn Deshay Lloyd in court. Attorney Glenn Oswald Givens Jr in court for Dayshawn Deshay Lloyd.  Attorney Eric Bashirian appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status of Counsel hearing or Order to Show Cause hearing or Indigency hearing. Discussion placed on the record. State Public Defender's Office failed to timely appoint counsel for the Defendant. Statements by Defendant. For reasons stated on the record, Court found Defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel at COUNTY EXPENSE. Court appointed Attorney Glenn Oswald Givens Jr to represent Defendant in this matter at County Expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. Court ordered the Defendant is NOT REQUIRED to reimburse Milwaukee County; however, Court ordered the Defendant to pay a one-time fee of $60.00 by the completion of the case.  Court reinstated Time Limits. Case adjourned for Preliminary hearing, Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dayshawn Deshay Lloyd in court, with attorney Thomas Reed on behalf of the Public Defender's Office. Defendant Dayshawn Deshay Lloyd in custody.  Attorney Eric Bashirian in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Order to show cause hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Attorney Thomas Reed advised the court, the Public Defender's Office is having issues appointing counsel. Court is allowing the Public Defender's Office one more opportunity to appoint counsel. Court will appoint Counsel at County Expense if no attorney is appointed by next hearing. Court Tolled time limits. Case adjourned for Status of Counsel hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Status of Counsel hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 8:45 am. Hearing will be held in room 113 of the Safety Building.
OSPD APPOINTMENT OF COUNSEL REPORT; received and filed.
Letter from defendant re:  signature bond.  (Dayshawn D. Lloyd - #2022008982, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Dayshawn Deshay Lloyd not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
OSPD APPOINTMENT OF COUNSEL REPORT; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Dayshawn Deshay Lloyd not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES, THIS HEARING WAS HEARD OFF THE RECORD:
Defendant Dayshawn Deshay Lloyd in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Dayshawn Deshay Lloyd in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dayshawn Deshay Lloyd appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
